metadata.title: Awesome Quantum Computing
metadata.description: A curated list of awesome quantum computing learning and developing resources, including comprehensive Azure Quantum, IBM Qiskit, and PennyLane QML documentation

features: Flexible gate definitions and custom gates
Integration with qsim for high-performance simulation

learning_path_sections: Quantum Computing Concepts: Qubits and Gates
Q# and Microsoft Quantum Development Kit Tools
Quantum Oracles and Simple Oracle Algorithms
Tools and Libraries/Building up to Shor's Algorithm

topics: Circuit Cutting Gate Cuts Wire Cuts
Loading classical data with low-depth circuits

learning.name: Learning
learning.description: Educational resources for learning quantum computing fundamentals and programming

resources.author: David Kemp

resources.description: An interactive platform for learning the fundamentals of quantum computing

resources.description: Easy to understand, step by step introduction to quantum computing concepts

resources.name: Quantum Computer Programming

resources.name: Quantum Computing with Microsoft QDK
resources.description: Manning liveProject series that guides the learner through implementation of a variety of protocols and algorithms using Microsoft QDK

resources.description: Easy to read knowledge base, rich of basic Quantum Computing concepts

resources.name: Quantum in the Cloud

resources.description: Programming exercises for learning quantum computing and Q#

resources.name: Quantum Machine Learning for Data Scientists

resources.description: Browser-based drag-and-drop quantum circuit simulator that reacts, simulates, and animates in real-time

resources.name: QWorld's Bronze-Qiskit
resources.description: Very accessible computation/programming oriented tutorials. It begins from basics of matrices up to grover's algorithm. There are also accompanying videos which explain the tutorials

resources.name: Tequila

resources.name: Quantum Computing for Everyone
resources.description: Introduction into topics such as qubits, entanglement, and quantum teleportation for the general reader

resources.name: Quantum Computing for the Quantum Curious

resources.name: Quantum Computing in Action
resources.description: For Java developers at all levels who want an early start in quantum computing

resources.name: Understanding Quantum Technologies
resources.description: Excellent Book which provides a 360 degree approach of quantum technologies encompassing all dimensions

resources.description: A cute introduction to quantum computing and computational complexity theory. It is intended for the widest possible target audience, and contains some topics of relevance to philosophy
resources.author: Scott Aaronson

resources.name: Programming the Universe: A Quantum Computer Scientist Takes on the Cosmos
resources.description: What if the universe is a giant quantum computer? It takes the reader through a journey of computational model of the universe and its implications on physics

resources.name: The Fabric of Reality: The Science of Parallel Universes and Its Implications
resources.description: It is of philosophical spirit, about revealing a unified fabric of reality explanation

non_english.name: Content in Non-English Languages
non_english.description: Quantum computing resources in languages other than English

resources.name: Quantum Computing in Portuguese
resources.description: A repository with curated content on Quantum Computing in Portuguese

azure_quantum.name: Azure Quantum
azure_quantum.description: Microsoft Azure Quantum platform documentation, Q# programming language, and quantum development resources

resources.name: Azure Quantum Documentation
resources.description: Official Azure Quantum documentation covering the quantum computing service, Q# programming language, and Quantum Development Kit (QDK). Learn to create quantum programs, submit jobs to quantum hardware, and use quantum simulators.

resources.name: Introduction to Q# Programming Language
resources.description: Q# is a high-level, open-source programming language developed by Microsoft for writing quantum programs. It is hardware agnostic, integrates quantum and classical computing, provides built-in qubit management, and respects the laws of quantum physics. Q# programs consist of namespaces, entry points, types (Int, Double, Bool, String, Result, Qubit), qubit allocation using 'use' keyword, quantum operations, and measurements.

resources.name: Create an Azure Quantum Workspace
resources.description: Guide to creating an Azure Quantum workspace in the Azure portal. A workspace is required to submit quantum jobs to hardware providers and access quantum simulators.

resources.name: Quantum Computing Providers on Azure Quantum
resources.description: List of quantum hardware providers available on Azure Quantum including IonQ (trapped-ion, up to 36 qubits), PASQAL (neutral atom, up to 100 qubits), Quantinuum (trapped-ion, up to 32 qubits with QCCD architecture), and Rigetti (superconducting, up to 84 qubits). Also includes quantum simulators and emulators from each provider.

resources.name: PASQAL Fresnel1 Quantum Processor
resources.description: PASQAL's Fresnel1 neutral atom-based quantum processor with up to 100 qubits. Uses optical tweezers and laser light to manipulate 1D and 2D quantum registers at room temperature with long coherence times and impressive qubit connectivity.

resources.name: Set up the Quantum Development Kit
resources.description: Installation guide for the Quantum Development Kit (QDK) which includes the Q# programming language, VS Code extension, Python integration, and quantum simulators.

resources.name: Ways to Run Q# Programs
resources.description: Different development environments for running Q# programs: online code editor on Microsoft Quantum website, local VS Code with QDK extension, Jupyter Notebooks with Python integration using %%qsharp magic command, and Azure Quantum portal.

resources.name: Q# Quickstart - Create Your First Q# Program
resources.description: Quickstart guide to creating your first Q# quantum program. Covers basic Q# syntax, qubit allocation, applying quantum gates like Hadamard (H), measurement, and running programs on simulators.

resources.name: Submit Jobs to Azure Quantum
resources.description: Guide to submitting quantum computing jobs to Azure Quantum providers. Covers job lifecycle management, scheduling, execution, monitoring, and viewing results in the Azure Quantum portal.

resources.name: Working with Q# Projects
resources.description: Guide to organizing Q# code into projects, managing multiple files, and structuring larger quantum applications.

resources.name: Testing and Debugging Q# Programs
resources.description: Techniques for testing and debugging quantum programs in Q#, including using the quantum simulator, DumpMachine for state inspection, and debugging tools in VS Code.

resources.name: Visualize Quantum Circuits
resources.description: How to visualize quantum circuits in Q# programs using the QDK circuit visualization tools.

resources.name: Long-Running Quantum Experiments
resources.description: Best practices for managing long-running quantum experiments on Azure Quantum, including job monitoring and result retrieval.

resources.name: Tutorial: Quantum Random Number Generator
resources.description: Tutorial to create a quantum random number generator using Q#. Demonstrates superposition and measurement to generate truly random numbers using quantum mechanics.

resources.name: Tutorial: Explore Quantum Entanglement
resources.description: Tutorial exploring quantum entanglement with Q#. Learn to create Bell states (EPR pairs) - the simplest and maximal examples of quantum entanglement using Hadamard and CNOT gates.

resources.name: Tutorial: Grover's Search Algorithm
resources.description: Tutorial implementing Grover's quantum search algorithm in Q#. Demonstrates quadratic speedup for unstructured search problems.

resources.name: Tutorial: Qubit-Level Programming
resources.description: Advanced tutorial on qubit-level programming in Q#, covering low-level quantum operations and gate implementations.

resources.name: VS Code Q# Reference
resources.description: Reference guide for using Q# in Visual Studio Code with the QDK extension. Covers IntelliSense, debugging, running programs, and submitting to Azure Quantum.

resources.name: Q# Program Structure
resources.description: Reference for Q# program structure including namespaces, entry points (@EntryPoint() or Main()), operations, functions, and the overall organization of Q# code. Includes Bell states implementation example.

resources.name: Q# Namespaces
resources.description: Reference for Q# namespaces. Namespaces organize related functionality and are optional in Q# programs. Standard library namespaces include Std.Core, Std.Intrinsic, and Std.Measurement.

resources.name: Q# Type Declarations
resources.description: Reference for Q# type declarations. Q# provides built-in types (Int, Double, Bool, String, Result, Qubit) and allows custom type definitions.

resources.name: Q# Callable Declarations
resources.description: Reference for Q# callable declarations including operations (quantum subroutines that can modify qubit state) and functions (classical computations). Operations are the basic building blocks of Q# programs.

resources.name: Q# Specialization Declarations
resources.description: Reference for Q# specialization declarations including adjoint and controlled variants of operations.

resources.name: IonQ Provider on Azure Quantum
resources.description: IonQ's trapped-ion quantum computers on Azure Quantum. Features include: universal gate-based computing, dynamically reconfigurable in software, fully connected qubits (any-to-any two-qubit gates), Ytterbium ions manipulated with laser pulses. Available systems: IonQ Aria 1 (25 qubits), IonQ Forte 1 (36 qubits), IonQ Forte Enterprise 1 (36 qubits), and GPU-accelerated simulator (29 qubits).

resources.name: Quantinuum Provider on Azure Quantum
resources.description: Quantinuum's trapped-ion quantum computers on Azure Quantum. Features: high-fidelity fully connected qubits, qubit reuse, laser-based gates with low error rates, mid-circuit measurements, QCCD (Quantum Charge-Coupled Device) architecture powered by Honeywell. Available systems: H2-1 (20 qubits), H2-2 (32 qubits), plus emulators and syntax checkers.

resources.name: Rigetti Provider on Azure Quantum
resources.description: Rigetti's superconducting quantum computers on Azure Quantum. Features: fast gate times, low-latency conditional logic, fast program execution, superconducting qubits using Josephson junctions (3-6GHz range), microwave/DC pulse operations. Available systems: Ankaa-3 (84 qubits), Cepheus-1-36Q (36 qubits), and QVM simulator (30 qubits).

resources.name: PASQAL Provider on Azure Quantum
resources.description: PASQAL's neutral atom quantum processors on Azure Quantum. Features: room temperature operation, long coherence times, impressive qubit connectivity, optical tweezers using laser light, 1D and 2D quantum registers. Available systems: Fresnel1 (100 qubits) and Emu-TN emulator (100 qubits).

resources.name: Azure Quantum Resource Estimator
resources.description: The Azure Quantum Resource Estimator allows you to assess architectural decisions, compare qubit technologies, and determine resources needed to execute quantum algorithms. Choose from pre-defined fault-tolerant protocols and specify physical qubit model assumptions. Free to use without an Azure account.

resources.name: Hybrid Quantum Computing Overview
resources.description: Introduction to hybrid quantum computing on Azure Quantum, combining classical and quantum computation for practical quantum advantage.

resources.name: Q# Standard Library - Std.Intrinsic
resources.description: Q# standard library Std.Intrinsic namespace containing commonly used operations and functions: M (measurement), H (Hadamard), X, Y, Z (Pauli gates), CNOT, Message, and more. Automatically loaded in Q# programs.

ibm_qiskit.name: IBM Qiskit
ibm_qiskit.description: IBM Qiskit SDK, IBM Quantum hardware, ecosystem projects, addons, and comprehensive quantum computing resources

resources.name: Qiskit SDK
resources.description: World's most popular and performant software stack for quantum computing. 13M+ downloads, 74% developer preference, 83x faster transpilation, 7K+ dependent projects. Build, optimize, and execute quantum workloads at scale with pip install qiskit.

resources.name: Qiskit GitHub Repository
resources.description: Open-source SDK for working with quantum computers at the level of extended quantum circuits, operators, and primitives. 6.8K stars, 2.7K forks, 634 contributors, Apache-2.0 license. Core component with transpiler, quantum information toolbox, and primitive functions (Sampler and Estimator).

resources.name: IBM Quantum Platform Documentation
resources.description: Comprehensive documentation for Qiskit and IBM Quantum Platform including how-to guides, tutorials, and API references. Covers circuit building, optimization, error mitigation, execution with primitives, post-processing, and Qiskit Functions.

resources.name: IBM Quantum Hardware - Eagle Processor
resources.description: 127-qubit Eagle processor with heavy-hex lattice topology. Features breakthrough packaging technologies for enhanced qubit control and scalability. EPLG: 1.98E-2, CLOPS: 180K.

resources.name: IBM Quantum Hardware - Heron Processor
resources.description: 133/156 fixed-frequency qubit processor with tunable couplers. Highest-performing IBM processor and core of System Two architecture. EPLG: 3.7E-3, CLOPS: 250K.

resources.name: IBM Quantum Hardware - Nighthawk Processor
resources.description: Next evolution of IBM chip architecture with 120 qubits on a square lattice with four-degree connectivity to scale workload complexity.

resources.name: IBM Quantum System Two
resources.description: Cornerstone of quantum-centric supercomputing. Flexible modular design allows multiple QPUs to be linked in data center environment. Combines scalable cryogenic infrastructure, classical runtime servers, and modular qubit control electronics.

resources.name: Qiskit Ecosystem
resources.description: Collection of open-source tools created by researchers and developers. 10+ pages of projects including TorchQuantum (1576 stars), Qiskit Machine Learning (889 stars), Aer simulator (618 stars), Mitiq error mitigation (411 stars), Qiskit Nature (367 stars), Qiskit Finance (296 stars), Qiskit Optimization (272 stars).

resources.name: Qiskit Aer
resources.description: High-performance quantum computing simulators with realistic noise models. IBM-maintained, 618 stars.

resources.name: Qiskit Machine Learning
resources.description: Flexible building blocks including quantum kernels and neural networks for quantum machine learning algorithms. Community-maintained, 889 stars.

resources.name: Qiskit Nature
resources.description: Model and solve problems in physics, chemistry, material science, and biology using quantum simulations. 367 stars.

resources.name: Qiskit Finance
resources.description: Uncertainty components for stock/securities problems, Ising translators for portfolio optimizations, and data providers. 296 stars.

resources.name: Qiskit Optimization
resources.description: Model optimization problems, convert between different representations, and solve with quantum algorithms. 272 stars.

resources.name: Qiskit Addons - AQC-Tensor
resources.description: Approximate quantum compilation with tensor networks. Enables construction of high-fidelity circuits with reduced depth.

resources.name: Qiskit Addons - Multi-Product Formulas (MPF)
resources.description: Reduces Trotter error of Hamiltonian dynamics through weighted combination of several circuit executions.

resources.name: Qiskit Addons - Operator Backpropagation (OBP)
resources.description: Reduces circuit depth by trimming operations from the end at the cost of more operator measurements.

resources.name: Qiskit Addons - Circuit Cutting
resources.description: Reduces depth of transpiled circuits by decomposing entangling gates between non-adjacent qubits.

resources.name: Qiskit Addons - Sample-based Quantum Diagonalization (SQD)
resources.description: Classically post-processes noisy quantum samples to yield more accurate eigenvalue estimations of quantum system Hamiltonians, especially for chemistry applications.

resources.name: Qiskit Addons - M3 (Matrix-free Measurement Mitigation)
resources.description: Scalable quantum measurement error mitigation that can be computed in parallel. 48 stars, IBM-maintained.

resources.name: Qiskit Hardware Plugins
resources.description: Backend-agnostic support for quantum execution across multiple hardware providers: IBM Quantum, IonQ, Amazon Braket, Azure Quantum, IQM, Rigetti, Quantinuum, Superstaq, AQT, Alice & Bob.

resources.name: Qiskit Serverless
resources.description: Simple interface to run workloads across quantum-classical resources, supporting multi-cloud and supercomputing use cases.

resources.name: QRMI - Quantum Resource Management Interface
resources.description: Standardizes and simplifies control of quantum resources for heterogeneous orchestration.

resources.name: Slurm Plugin for Qiskit
resources.description: Allows management of quantum resources using the Slurm workload manager for HPC integration.

resources.name: IBM Quantum Learning
resources.description: Library of 10+ courses from leading experts. Features 'Basics of Quantum Information' with John Watrous and 'Quantum Computing in Practice' with Olivia Lanes. Includes instructional modules for STEM courses.

resources.name: IBM Quantum Tutorials
resources.description: End-to-end examples applying Qiskit to common quantum computing use cases. Covers verifiable sampling algorithms, observable estimation, fault-tolerant algorithms, workload optimization, Qiskit Functions, addons, error mitigation, and error detection.

resources.name: IBM Quantum Research

resources.description: Realistic code examples implementing latest research workflows with Qiskit and Qiskit addons. Includes Implicit Solvent Model template and Hamiltonian Simulation template.
